Further, as is well known, urbanisation increases with rising
per capita GDP in a 'hockey stick' fashion with cities
providing large economies of agglomeration for individual
activity. If India's per capita GDP were to grow at a
double-digit rate, as is being targeted by the government,
over 40% of Indians could be living in cities in the next
decade against the 30% living in urban areas today.
(Source: World Bank and Lehman Bros)

dividend, rising incomes and increasing urbanisation
